result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin Dory Ferguson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Court ordered monies taken by the DOC's from up to 25% of prison funds. The balance would then be paid while on ES. If not paid, will convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No controlled substances or alcohol.
- AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
- Random urine screens to ensure compliance.
- Seek/maintain full time employment and/or schooling at least 40 hours a week.
- No Contact with Rayshawn Williams or Daren Hayes.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin Dory Ferguson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Quentin Dory Ferguson not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  The Court is currently in trial and the matter had to be adjourned.  Matter is adjourned to October 22, 2015 at 1:30pm for sentencing in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Quentin Dory Ferguson in court with Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Quentin Dory Ferguson in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Final Pre-trial.  Due to the Defendant pleading, the Court VACATED the October 14, 2015 Jury Trial date.  As to the plea.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  The matter was set for sentencing on October 14, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Quentin Dory Ferguson in court with Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Quentin Dory Ferguson in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Final Pretrial Conference.  The State filed a Joinder Motion.  The Defense objects.  Arguments heard.  The Court GRANTED the State's Motion.  The Defense motioned to have this case DISMISSED.  The Court DENIED that Motion.  The Court indicated that all discovery has to be given to all parties by Friday, October 2, 2015.  Matter set for a final pre-trial conference on October 7, 2015 at 8:30am.  Parties will be prepared to go to trial on October 14, 2015 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
